back.text:
Root: ب ر ك (B-R-K)
Meaning: Blessed is He
Pronunciation: Tabāraka
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the bā.
Derived Words:
1. بَرَكَة (Barakah): blessing
Example Ayah: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ

hint.text: Opening word of the surah, declaring Allah’s blessedness.

back.text:
Root: م ل ك (M-L-K)
Meaning: The dominion, sovereignty
Pronunciation: Al-Mulk
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** (clear lām).
Derived Words:
1. مَلِك (Malik): king
2. مَالِك (Mālik): owner
Example Ayah: قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ مَالِكَ الْمُلْكِ

hint.text: Central theme of the surah: Allah’s absolute rule.

back.text:
Root: ب ل و (B-L-W)
Meaning: That He may test you
Pronunciation: Liyabluwakum
Tajweed Rules: —
Derived Words:
1. بَلَاء (Balā’): a trial
Example Ayah: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ

hint.text: Purpose of life and death: a test.

back.text:
Root: س م و (S-M-W)
Meaning: Heavens
Pronunciation: Samāwātin
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the mā.
Derived Words:
1. سَمَاء (Samā’): sky
Example Ayah: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا

hint.text: Refers to the seven heavens.

back.text:
Root: ف ط ر (F-Ṭ-R)
Meaning: A flaw, cracks
Pronunciation: Fuṭūr
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the ṭū.
Derived Words:
1. فِطْرَة (Fiṭrah): innate nature
Example Ayah: هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٍ

hint.text: Challenge to find any defect in creation.

back.text:
Root: ص ب ح (Ṣ-B-Ḥ)
Meaning: The lamps (stars)
Pronunciation: Al-Maṣābīḥ
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**, **Madd Tabi'i** on ṣā and bī.
Derived Words:
1. مِصْبَاح (Miṣbāḥ): lamp
Example Ayah: مَثَلُ نُورِهِ كَمِشْكَاةٍ فِيهَا مِصْبَاحٌ

hint.text: Stars described as lamps in the sky.

back.text:
Root: ش ه ق (Sh-H-Q)
Meaning: A terrible roar/inhale
Pronunciation: Shahīqan
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the hī.
Derived Words:
1. شَهِيق (Shahīq): roar
Example Ayah: لَهَا شَهِيقٌ وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

hint.text: Sound of Hellfire’s violent inhaling.

back.text:
Root: ف و ر (F-W-R)
Meaning: It boils, rages
Pronunciation: Tafūru
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the fū.
Derived Words:
1. فَوْرَة (Fawrah): outburst
Example Ayah: وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

hint.text: Describes Hell’s furious boiling.

back.text:
Root: ص ر ط (Ṣ-R-Ṭ)
Meaning: A path
Pronunciation: Ṣirāṭ
Tajweed Rules: Heavy **Ṣād**, **Madd Tabi'i** on rā.
Derived Words: —
Example Ayah: اهْدِنَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ

hint.text: The straight path of guidance.

back.text:
Root: ع ذ ب (ʿ-Dh-B)
Meaning: Punishment
Pronunciation: ʿAdhābin
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the dhā.
Derived Words:
1. عَذَّبَ (ʿAdhdhaba): he punished
Example Ayah: وَلَكُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

hint.text: General term for divine punishment.

back.text:
Root: ف أ د (F-ʾ-D)
Meaning: The hearts
Pronunciation: Al-Afʾidah
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words:
1. فُؤَاد (Fuʾād): heart
Example Ayah: جَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ

hint.text: Inner hearts that comprehend and feel.

back.text:
Root: م ن ن (M-N-N)
Meaning: Cut off / interrupted
Pronunciation: Mamnūn
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the nū.
Derived Words:
1. مَنّ (Mann): favor, blessing
Example Ayah: أَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ

hint.text: A reward that will never be cut off.

back.text:
Root: ق د ر (Q-D-R)
Meaning: All-Powerful
Pronunciation: Qadīr
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on dī.
Derived Words:
1. قُدْرَة (Qudrah): power
Example Ayah: وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرًا

hint.text: Allah’s attribute of perfect power.

back.text:
Root: م و ت (M-W-T)
Meaning: Death
Pronunciation: Al-Mawt
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**, **Madd Layyin** on maw.
Derived Words:
1. مَيْت (Mayt): dead
Example Ayah: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَائِقَةُ الْمَوْتِ

hint.text: One of the two creations (life & death) for the test.

back.text:
Root: خ ب ر (Kh-B-R)
Meaning: All-Aware
Pronunciation: Khabīr
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on bī.
Derived Words:
1. خَبَر (Khabar): news
Example Ayah: وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

hint.text: Allah’s attribute of being fully aware.

back.text:
Root: ج ن ن (J-N-N)
Meaning: Gardens
Pronunciation: Jannātin
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on nā.
Derived Words:
1. جَنَّة (Jannah): Paradise garden
Example Ayah: جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ

hint.text: The reward of the righteous.

back.text:
Root: ن ه ر (N-H-R)
Meaning: The rivers
Pronunciation: Al-Anhāru
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**, **Madd Tabi'i** on hā.
Derived Words:
1. نَهْر (Nahr): river
Example Ayah: جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ

hint.text: Rivers beneath the gardens of Paradise.

back.text:
Root: غ ي ث (Gh-Y-Th)
Meaning: Rain, relief
Pronunciation: Ghaythan
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Layyin** on ghay.
Derived Words:
1. غَيْث (Ghayth): rain
Example Ayah: فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً غَيْثًا

hint.text: Rain sent as mercy and revival.

back.text:
Root: ع ل م (ʿ-L-M)
Meaning: All-Knowing
Pronunciation: ʿAlīm
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on lī.
Derived Words:
1. عِلْم (ʿIlm): knowledge
Example Ayah: وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

hint.text: Allah’s attribute of complete knowledge.

back.text:
Root: غ ف ر (Gh-F-R)
Meaning: The Forgiving
Pronunciation: Al-Ghafūr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**, **Madd Tabi'i** on fū.
Derived Words:
1. مَغْفِرَة (Maghfirah): forgiveness
Example Ayah: إِنَّ اللَّهَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ

hint.text: Allah’s attribute of forgiving sins.

back.text:
Root: — (proper name)
Meaning: Hell
Pronunciation: Jahannam
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the n.
Derived Words: —
Example Ayah: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا

hint.text: The abode of punishment for disbelievers.

back.text:
Root: خ س أ (Kh-S-ʾ)
Meaning: Humiliated, rejected
Pronunciation: Al-Khāsiʾ
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words:
1. خُسُوء (Khusūʾ): humiliation
Example Ayah: وَهُوَ خَاسِئٌ

hint.text: The state of the arrogant in Hell.

back.text:
Root: س ع ر (S-ʿ-R)
Meaning: It blazes, rages
Pronunciation: Tastaʿiru
Tajweed Rules: —
Derived Words:
1. سَعِير (Saʿīr): blazing fire
Example Ayah: وَهِيَ تَسْتَعِرُ

hint.text: Describes the intensifying fire of Hell.

back.text:
Root: ف و ج (F-W-J)
Meaning: A group, company
Pronunciation: Fawj
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Layyin** on faw.
Derived Words:
1. فَوْجًا (Fawjan): in groups
Example Ayah: كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ

hint.text: Groups thrown into Hell one after another.

back.text:
Root: ث ق ل (Th-Q-L)
Meaning: An atom’s weight
Pronunciation: Mithqāla
Tajweed Rules: **Ikhfāʾ** of the th.
Derived Words:
1. ثَقِيل (Thaqīl): heavy
Example Ayah: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ

hint.text: Even the tiniest deed will be weighed.
